name: sloppiness
content:
sloppiness noun [U]
(CARELESSNESS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving a lack of care or effort: The work has been criticized for sloppiness and errors. There was a general sloppiness in the way the business was run.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is no evidence of particular sloppiness by the airport security. The chef saw so much sloppiness in the kitchen that he flew into one of his rages.He passed the ball with an alarming sloppiness.

sloppiness noun [U]
(LOOSENESS)
(of clothes) the quality of being untidy and too big or loose: The jacket seemed a bit big but I love its comfortable sloppiness. You may need to speak to her about the sloppiness of her appearance.
More examplesFewer examplesWhile disapproving of the sloppiness of his clothes, she envied him his ease.There's a funny sloppiness that occurs in many a mom's wardrobe.

sloppiness noun [U]
(WET)
informal disapproving the state of being too liquid, often in an unpleasant way: Serve with bread to scoop up all that delicious sloppiness. I forgot to mention the sloppiness of the chocolate pots. They were a mess.
More examplesFewer examplesI add extra sauce, and the kids love the sloppiness of this dish.The individual ingredients were lost in the overall sloppiness of the burger.The problem was not really the food itself, but more the sloppiness of the food.
